meanings.definition: To revoke or annul (a decision or action)
meanings.sent1: She reevokes her promise to help him.
meanings.sent2: The judge reevokes the previous ruling.
meanings.sent3: He reevokes his offer to share his lunch, leaving his friend hungry.
meanings.sent4: The storm reevokes any hope of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look reevokes silence in the noisy classroom.

meanings.definition: To call back or recall (something previously said or done)
meanings.sent1: The coach reevokes the team from the field due to the storm.
meanings.sent2: She reevokes her hurtful words and apologizes.
meanings.sent3: The magician reevokes the rabbit from the hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The melody reevokes memories of childhood summers.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies reevokes warmth and comfort in the kitchen.
